New Records: Freddie Freeman hit the first walk-off grand slam in World Series history.
Key Match Events: Freddie Freeman hit a walk-off grand slam in the 10th inning to win the game for the Dodgers.
Jazz Chisholm Jr. stole two bases in the 10th inning.
Shohei Ohtani hit a line drive that nearly resulted in his first World Series home run.
Nestor Cortes, who was deemed out for the season, made a dramatic appearance in the game.
Post-Match Reflections: Freddie Freeman expressed his joy, saying, 'That’s the stuff when you're five years old in the backyard, that’s a dream come true.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was compared to the 1988 World Series Game 1 and the 1996 ALCS fan interference call, which was reversed this time.
